metadata.title: CVE-2023-52756 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:pwm: Fix double shift bugThese enums are passed to set/test_bit().  The set/test_bit() functionstake a bit number instead of a shifted value.  Passing a shifted valueis a double shift bug like doing BIT(BIT(1)).  The double shift bugdoesn't cause a problem here because we are only checking 0 and 1 butif the value was 5 or above then it can lead to a buffer overflow.

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
